post.summary: Performs authentication to access to the SORACOM API.
post.description: Performs authentication to access to the SORACOM API. To perform authentication by a root account, specify `email` and `password`. To perform authentication by an AuthKey, specify `authKeyId` and `authKey`. To perform authentication by a SAM user, specify `operatorId`, `userName` and `password`. An API Key and an API Token will be included in the response if successful. Specify the API Key and the API Token to requests afterwards

post.summary: Issues a password reset token for the operator.
post.description: Generates a password reset token and send it to the operator's mail address. After receiving the password reset token, call /v1/auth/password_reset_token/verify API with the token to update operator's password.

post.summary: Verifies the password reset token and updates password.
post.description: Updates the operator's password if the password reset token is verified.

404.description: Token expired.

get.description: Returns a list of credentials.

post.description: Creates a new credential.

put.description: Updates a credential.

400.description: There was an error in the request or the specified token has already expired. (In the latter case, you will need to use the /auth API to do authentication once again.)

delete.description: Deletes a credential.

404.description: Not Found

post.description: Makes a request to create a new operator. An e-mail is sent to the e-mail address specified in the parameters, containing a one-time token for verifying the operator’s registration.

400.description: The e-mail address is already registered or the password has an incorrect format.

post.description: Sends an e-mail with a one-time token for executing the e-mail address change.
Verifies the token for the e-mail address change, and then changes the e-mail address.
Verifies the operator's registration. Called by setting as parameter the one-time verification token received via e-mail.

404.description: The one-time token has expired.

get.description: Returns information about the operator.
Returns the operator's AuthKey list.

post.description: Generates an AuthKey for the operator.

delete.description: Deletes an AuthKey from the operator.

post.description: Updates the operator's password.
Returns a token for accessing the support console.

Generates a new API token. If you insert the current API token into the header and make a request, a response is returned containing the new API token. You can then use the new API token in future requests.

400.description: There was an error in the request or the specified token has already expired. (In the latter case, you will need to use the /auth API to do authentication once again.)

post.description: Issues a token to revoke operator's MFA. The issued token will be sent to the operator via email.

404.description: Operator not found

post.description: Verifies the one-time token which is previously issued by calling `/operators/mfa_revoke_token/issue` API, operator's email address, password, and one of the backup codes. If verified, operator's MFA is going to be revoked.

get.description: Gets operator's MFA status. The MFA status is one of `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE` or `UNCONFIRMED`.

post.description: Enables operator's MFA. After calling this APIg, it should be verified by calling `Operator:verifyMFA` API.

delete.description: Revokes operator's MFA without backup codes.

post.description: Verifies operator's MFA with OTP code after calling `Operator:enableMFA` API. MFA will not be activated unless the MFA OTP is verified with this API. Backup codes are going to be returned in the response. These codes must be securely stored.

get.description: Returns a list of roles.
Retrieves a role.

post.description: Adds a new role.

put.description: Edits a role.

delete.description: Deletes a role.

get.description: Retrieves a list of users attached to a role.
Retrieves a list of the user's roles.

post.description: Attaches a role to a user.

delete.description: Detaches a role from a user.

get.description: Returns a list of shipping addresses.

post.description: Creates a new shipping address.

get.description: Returns a shipping address.

put.description: Updates a shipping address.

delete.description: Deletes a shipping address.

get.description: Returns a list of SAM users.
Returns a SAM user.

post.description: Adds a new SAM user.

put.description: Updates the SAM user.

404.description: SAM User not found.

delete.description: Deletes the SAM user.

404.description: SAM User not found.

get.description: Returns the SAM user's AuthKey list.

post.description: Generates an AuthKey for the SAM user.

get.description: Returns the SAM user's AuthKey.

delete.description: Deletes an AuthKey from the SAM user.

404.description: AuthKey not found.

get.description: Retrieves whether the SAM user has a password or not.

post.description: Creates a password for the SAM user.

put.description: Updates the password of the SAM user.

delete.description: Deletes the user's password.

404.description: Password registration is required.

get.description: Retrieves the SAM user's permissions.

put.description: Updates the SAM user's permissions.

get.description: Returns a list of subscribers that match certain criteria. If the total number of subscribers does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: Tag name for filtering the search (exact match).

parameters.name: tag_value
parameters.description: Tag search string for filtering the search. Required when `tag_name` has been specified.

parameters.name: status_filter
parameters.description: Status for filtering the search. Can specify multiple values delimited by `|`. Valid values include: `active`, `inactive`, `ready`, `instock`, `shipped`, `suspended`, and `terminated`.

parameters.name: speed_class_filter
parameters.description: Speed class for filtering the search. Can specify multiple values delimited by `|`. Valid values include: `s1.minimum`, `s1.slow`, `s1.standard`, `s1.fast`

parameters.name: serial_number_filter
parameters.description: Serial number for filtering the search. Can specify multiple values delimited by `|`. Returns subscribers with serial number starting with the specified value(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of subscribers to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The IMSI of the last subscriber retrieved on the current page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next subscriber onward.

post.description: Registers a subscriber.

get.description: Returns information about the specified subscriber.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Changes the speed class of the specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Deletes session for the specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Activates status of specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Deactivates specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Terminates the specified subscriber

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Suspends the specified subscriber

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Set the specified subscriber to standby mode.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

400.description: The specified subscriber does not support standby mode.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Enables termination of specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Disables termination of specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Updates expiry time of specified subscriber.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Expiry time after the update (unixtime: in milliseconds).

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Deletes expiry time of specified subscriber and changes it to indefinite.

204.description: Change of specified subscriber's expiry time to indefinite complete.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist or the subscriber does not have an expiry time.

post.description: Sets or overwrites a group for the specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.description: Removes the group configuration from the specified subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist or the subscriber does not belong to a group.

post.summary: Set IMEI lock configuration for Subscriber.
post.description: Set IMEI that the subscriber should be locked to.

parameters.name: imeiLock
parameters.description: IMEI lock configuration for the subscriber. (IMEI can be left blank for locking to the current IMEI of an online subscriber.)

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

400.description: Invalid IMEI string or subscriber is offline and IMEI not specified.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.summary: Unset IMEI lock configuration for Subscriber.
post.description: Remove any existing IMEI lock configuration for the subscriber.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

get.description: Returns the event history for the specified subscriber, including session creation, change, and deletion. If the total number of events does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the `Link` header of the response.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time for the events search range (unixtime).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time for the events search range (unixtime).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The time stamp of the last event retrieved on the current page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next event onward.

put.summary: Bulk Insert or Update Subscriber Tags.
put.description: Inserts/updates tags for the specified subscriber.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Array of tags to be inserted/updated.

200.description: The subscriber's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

delete.description: Deletes a tag from the specified subscriber.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: Tag name to be deleted. (This will be part of a URL path, so it needs to be percent-encoded. In JavaScript, specify the name after it has been encoded using encodeURIComponent().)

404.description: The specified subscriber or the tag does not exist.

post.description: Sends the subscriber's inter-operator control transfer token to the control destination operator.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Destination operator's email address, Operator ID, transferring IMSI

post.description: Verifies the subscriber's control transfer token, and executes the transfer. This API is called from the operator of the control destination.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Subscriber transfer token that noficed via email.

delete.description: Deletes the subscriber's inter-operator control transfer token, and cancels the control transfer.

404.description: The token does not exist.

get.summary: Get data sent from a subscriber.
get.description: Returns a list of data entries sent from a subscriber that match certain criteria. If the total number of entries does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.name: imsi
parameters.description: IMSI of the target subscriber that generated data entries.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time for the data entries search range (unixtime in milliseconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time for the data entries search range (unixtime in milliseconds).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order of the data entries. Either descending (latest data entry first) or ascending (oldest data entry first).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of data entries to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The value of `time` in the last log entry retrieved in the previous page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next page onward.

post.description: Send SMS to the specified subscriber.

parameters.name: smsForwardingRequest
parameters.description: SMS forwarding request that contains message body and its encoding type.

202.description: SMS forwarding report containing message ID.

400.description: The specified subscriber does not support SMS API.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

post.summary: Triggers Subscriber to report SIM local info.
post.description: Triggers Subscriber to report SIM local info.

202.description: The local info reporting has successfully been triggered. The subscriber information is asynchronously updated when the SIM reports the information back.

400.description: The specified subscriber does not support local info reporting feature.

404.description: The specified subscriber does not exist.

get.description: Returns a list of LoRa devices that match certain criteria. If the total number of LoRa devices does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: Tag name for filtering the search (exact match).

parameters.name: tag_value
parameters.description: Tag search string for filtering the search. Required when `tag_name` has been specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of LoRa devices to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The device ID of the last device retrieved on the current page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next device onward.

post.description: Registers a LoRa device.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Device ID of the target LoRa device.

get.description: Returns information about the specified LoRa device.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Device ID of the target LoRa device.

404.description: The specified LoRa device does not exist.

get.summary: Get data sent from a LoRa device.
get.description: Returns a list of data entries sent from a LoRa device that match certain criteria. If the total number of entries does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Device ID of the target subscriber that generated data entries.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time for the data entries search range (unixtime in milliseconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time for the data entries search range (unixtime in milliseconds).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order of the data entries. Either descending (latest data entry first) or ascending (oldest data entry first).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of data entries to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The value of `time` in the last log entry retrieved in the previous page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next page onward.

post.summary: Send data to a LoRa device.
post.description: Sends data to the specified LoRa device. The data is sent to the LoRa network server, to be sent out to the device using the next available slot. If another message destined for the same LoRa device ID is already waiting to be sent, the existing message will be discarded, and the new message will be sent instead.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Binary data encoded as a hexadecimal string. Maximum length of original binary data is 11 octets (22 characters when encoded as a hexadecimal string). The number of characters must be even. fPort MUST be equal to or greater than 0. 0 is used for the control plane and 1 or greater values should be used in general. It defaults to 2 to avoid the issues of some devices from some vendors and all invalid values that can not be parsed fallback to 2.

204.description: Data has been received and sent to the LoRa network server for the recipient device to retrieve.

400.description: The payload JSON data contains one or more invalid parameters.

404.description: No such device found.

post.description: Terminates the specified LoRa device

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Device ID of the target LoRa device.

200.description: The LoRa device's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified LoRa device does not exist.

post.description: Enables termination of specified LoRa device.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Device ID of the target LoRa device.

200.description: The LoRa device's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified LoRa device does not exist.

post.description: Disables termination of specified LoRa device.

parameters.description: Device ID of the target LoRa device.

200.description: The LoRa device's detailed information after the update.

404.description: The specified LoRa device does not exist.

parameters.description: Device ID of the target LoRa device.

get.summary: Get data sent from a Sigfox device.

post.summary: Send data to a Sigfox device.

If another message destined for the same Sigfox device ID is already waiting to be sent, the existing message will be discarded, and the new message will be sent instead.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Binary data encoded as a hexadecimal string. Length of original binary data must be 8 octets (16 characters when encoded as a hexadecimal string).

204.description: Data has been received by server and waiting for the recipient device to retrieve.

404.description: No such device found.

get.description: Returns past billing history (after applied discounts such as free tiers, etc., inclusive of tax). This API only returns the billing amounts that have been finalized at the end of the month.
Returns the latest billing amounts after applied discounts such as free tiers, etc. The amounts retrieved using this API correspond to the values before the invoice was finalized.

post.summary: Export latest billing CSV file to S3.
post.description: Returns detailed information of the billing amounts for the latest month. This detailed information includes billing amounts per day, subscriber, and billing item. The amounts retrieved using this API correspond to the values before the invoice was finalized.

get.description: Returns the billing history for the specified month (after applied discounts such as free tiers, etc., inclusive of tax). The amounts retrieved using this API correspond to the values before the invoice was finalized.
Returns detailed information of billing amounts per day for the specified month. This API only returns the billing amounts that have been finalized.

post.summary: Output billing CSV file to S3.
post.description: Returns detailed information for the billing amounts for the specified month. This detailed information includes billing amounts per day, subscriber, and billing item.

get.description: Returns a list of currently registered coupons.

post.description: Registers a coupon.

get.description: Returns result of a payment transaction.
Returns current payment methods. Detailed information is included in the properties.

post.description: Activates a current payment method that has an error.

post.summary: Register credit card information for WebPay.
post.description: Registers credit card information for WebPay payments.

get.description: List payment statements.

post.description: Export payment statement.

get.description: Export payer information.

post.description: Register payer information.

parameters.name: req
parameters.description: Payer information to be registered in the accounting specification

get.description: Returns a list of event handlers.

post.description: Creates a new event handler. Please see also https://dev.soracom.io/en/docs/event_handler/

get.summary: List Event Handlers related to Subscriber.
get.description: Returns a list of event handlers related to the specified IMSI.

404.description: not found

get.description: Returns information about the specified event handler.

404.description: Handler not found.

put.description: Updates the specified event handler. Please see also https://dev.soracom.io/en/docs/event_handler/

delete.description: Deletes the specified event handler.

404.description: EventHandler not found.

post.description: Adds a setting for ignoring the specified event handler of the specified IMSI.

delete.description: Deletes the setting for ignoring the specified event handler of the specified IMSI.

404.description: not found

get.description: Get an exported file. The `url` field in the response will contain a URL to download the exported file.
Returns a list of confirmed orders.

post.description: Creates a new order quotation. If the orderId is put in /confirm, the order is complete.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Order item list and shipping address ID

get.description: Returns a confirmed order.

put.description: Cancels an order. If the order has already been dispatched, an error is returned.
Performs a credit limit and confirms the order if no problems are encountered.

post.description: Registers the ordered SIM with the operator.

get.description: List ordered subscribers

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: Serial number of the last subscriber in the previous page that is set to response header with X-Soracom-Next-Key.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of subscribers in a response.

get.description: Returns a list of products.

get.summary: Get Air Usage Report of Subscriber.
get.description: Retrieves the usage report for the subscriber specified by the IMSI.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time in unixtime for the aggregate data.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time in unixtime for the aggregate data.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Units of aggregate data. For minutes, the interval is around 5 minutes.

get.summary: Get Beam Usage Report of Subscriber.
get.description: Retrieves the Soracom Beam usage report for the subscriber specified by the IMSI.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time in unixtime for the aggregate data.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time in unixtime for the aggregate data.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Units of aggregate data. For minutes, the interval is around 5 minutes.

post.summary: Export Air Usage Report of All Subscribers.
post.description: Retrieves a file containing the usage report of all subscribers for the specified operator. The report data range is specified with from, to in unixtime. The report contains monthly data. The file output destination is AWS S3. The file output format is CSV.

post.summary: Export Beam Usage Report of All Subscribers.
post.description: Retrieves a file containing the usage report of all subscribers for the specified operator. The report data range is specified with from, to in unixtime. The report contains monthly data. The file output destination is AWS S3. The file output format is CSV.

get.description: Returns a list of groups.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: Tag name of the group. Filters through all groups that exactly match the tag name. When tag_name is specified, tag_value is required.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results per response page.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The last Group ID retrieved on the current page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next group onward.

parameters.name: Tags

get.description: Returns a list of log entries that match certain criteria. If the total number of entries does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.description: Type of the target resource to query log entries.

parameters.description: Identity of the target resource to query log entries.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Service name to filter log entries.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time for the log search range (unixtime).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time for the log search range (unixtime).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of log entries to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The value of `time` in the last log entry retrieved in the previous page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next page onward.

get.summary: Get data sent from a resource.
get.description: Returns a list of data entries sent from a resource that match certain criteria. If the total number of entries does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start time for the data entries search range (unixtime in milliseconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End time for the data entries search range (unixtime in milliseconds).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order of the data entries. Either descending (latest data entry first) or ascending (oldest data entry first).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of data entries to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The value of `time` in the last log entry retrieved in the previous page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next page onward.

get.summary: Get the list of data source resources
get.description: Returns a list of data source resources that have sent data from resources that belong to the operator. If the total number of entries does not fit in one page, a URL for accessing the next page is returned in the 'Link' header of the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of data entries to retrieve.

parameters.name: last_evaluated_key
parameters.description: The value of `resourceId` in the last log entry retrieved in the previous page. By specifying this parameter, you can continue to retrieve the list from the next page onward.

200.description: A list of data source resources.

get.description: Gets a data entry identified with resource ID and timestamp

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp of the target data entry to get (unixtime in milliseconds).

200.description: The data entry specified with resource ID and timestamp

404.description: No such entry found

delete.description: Deletes a data entry identified with resource ID and timestamp

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Timestamp of the target data entry to delete (unixtime in milliseconds).

204.description: The data entry has been successfully deleted

message.description: エラーメッセージ。リクエスト時にX-Soracom-Langヘッダーに言語(en,ja)を設定するとその言語のメッセージがセットされます。

tokenTimeoutSeconds.description:
新しい API トークンの有効期限の長さ（秒単位）。
指定しなければデフォルトは 86400 [秒]（24時間）。
最大値は 172800 [秒]（48時間）。

password.description: パスワードは以下の条件を満たしている必要があります：長さ 8 文字以上100 文字以内、アルファベット小文字 (a-z) を 1 文字以上使用、アルファベット大文字 (A-Z) を 1 文字以上使用、数字を 1 文字以上使用。記号なども使用できます。

paymentStatus.description: 直近の課金ステータス

lastEvaluatedTime.description: 利用額計算を実施した時間

errorCode.description: エラーコード（支払い情報が無効な場合のみ）

price.description: 商品販売個数ごとの価格

status.description: ファイル出力ステータス

url.description: ファイルダウンロードURL

message.description: SendMailAction, SendMailToOperatorAction の時のみ有効

exportedFileId.description: ファイル出力ID(リクエストにexport_mode=asyncを指定した場合）

url.description: ファイルダウンロードURL(export_mode指定なし、もしくはexport_mode=syncの場合

encodingType.description: Encoding type of the message body. `1` indicates the body is `DCS_7BIT` that only supports single byte characters. `2` is `DCS_UCS2` that supports multi-byte text. When omitted, it is treated as `2` (`DCS_UCS2`).

userPassword.description: This password is used by the initial user's login.

lagoonUserEmail.description: This email address is used on login with the initial user.

A role that represents the permission.

id.description: Lagoon user ID assigned to the created user.
